ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you feel sick to stomach? Vomited? Observation
Notes: 0=no nausea; 1=mild; 2= (blank); 3= (blank); 4= intermittent; 5= (blank); 6=(blank); 7= constant nausea; -99= missing

ElementDescription: Observation of visible tremors with extended arms and fingers spread apart.
Notes: 0=no tremor; 1=not visible;2= (blank); 3= (blank); 4=moderate; 5= (blank); 6= (blank); 7: severe; -99= missing
0=no visible sweat; 1= barely visible/palms moist; 2= (blank); 3=(blank); 4=obvious beads of sweat; 5= (blank); 6=(blank); 7= drenching sweats; -99= missing
0=no anxiety; 1= mild anxious; 2= (blank); 3= (blank); 4 moderately anxious; 5= (blank); 6 (blank); 7= equivalent to acute panic stress or pschizophrenic reactions; -99 missing

ElementDescription: Have you any itching, pins and needles sensations, any burning, any numbness, or do you feel bugs crawling on or under your skin? Observation
Notes: 0= none; 1= very mild itching; 2=mild itching; 3= moderate itching; 4=moderately severe hallucinations; 5= severe hallucinations; 6= extremely severe hallucinations; 7=continuous hallucinations; -99=missing

ElementDescription: Are you more aware of sounds around you? Are they harsh? Do they frighten you? Are you hearing anything that is disturbing to you? Are you hearing things you know are not there? Observation
Notes: 0=not present; 1=very mild harshness; 2=mild harshness; 3=moderate harshness; 4=moderately severe hallucinations; 5=severe halluciantions; 6= extremely severe hallucinations; 7= continuous halluciantions; -99 missing

ElementDescription: Does the light appear to be too bright? Is its color different? Does it hurt your eyes? Are you seeing anything that is disturbing to you? Are you seeing things you know are not there? Observation
Notes: 0=not present; 1=very mild sensitivity; 2=mild sensitivity; 3=moderate sensitivity; 4=moderately severe hallucinations; 5=severe halluciantions; 6= extremely severe hallucinations; 7= continuous halluciantions; -99 missing

ElementDescription: Does your head feel different? Does it feel like there is a band around your head? Observation
Notes: 0=not present; 1=very mild; 2=mild; 3=moderate; 4=moderately severe; 5=severe; 6=very severe= 7=extremely severe; -99= missing
0=normal activity; 1=somewhat normal; 2=(blank); 3= (blank); 4=moderately fidgety/restless; 5=(blank); 6=(blank); 7=pacing, thrashes about; -99=missing

ElementDescription: Orientation and Clouding of Sensorium: Ask the following; (What day is this?) (Where are you?) (Who am I?)
Notes: 0=oriented; 1=uncertain of date; 2=disoriented for date no more than 2 days; 3= disoriented for date more than 2 days; 4= disoriented for place/person; -99=missing
998=Not calculable because of remote procedures
99=week 10-week 14
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project (used for source IDs that change depending on timepoint/visit/etc.)
Was this assessment done in person or remotely?
Notes: 0 = In person; 1 = Remotely
-9=Missing; -5=Item/Instrument not collected; -2=Not collected at this time point
-9=Missing; -5=Item/Instrument not collected; -2=Not collected at this time point

ElementDescription: Was the questionnaire administered during this visit?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes
